column4: check to see catalyst actually supports that card. I suspect it doesn't
already checked, it does not support that card anymore
looks like the radeon or radeonhd driver is your only choice now
so how to I enable that driver for the install CD for 10.04?
should be auto enabled
for some reason the CD gets to the Ubuntu logo with the progress dots and then the screen just goes blank and nothing else happens period
huh. that's crap. I am going to figure out how to get ubuntu to display messages when it boots instead of just using splashscreens, as I am wanting to do that for myself.
then hopefully you'll get some kind of message when you boot that you can work off.
that would a great step in getting 10.04 on this laptop
oh is this for the live CD?
yes
http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=2803726&postcount=2 this looks like it
thanks I will take a look
ok, this version of ubuntu doesn't have a menu.lst. hmm. things have changed:P
not only that, but I don't think that will work with the liveCD only on an installed system
oh yeah I forgot. huh, how old is your system?
it's an HP Compaq nc8430 with intel centrino duo CPU, 2GB RAM, ATI Radeon x1600 256MB graphics, intel pro wireless 3945ABG card. It's about 4 years old I think
it's an HP Compaq nc8430 with intel centrino duo CPU, 2GB RAM, ATI Radeon x1600 256MB graphics, intel pro wireless 3945ABG card. It's about 4 years old I think
right, and you install the CD and it just freezes? hmm. do check that the disk has no errors
for the help I will test the disk and if neseccary, download and burn a new one
that's the thing I've never had trouble with ubuntu before on this laptop, weird
